Sentencas: The effect of adding transition-metal catalysts to the surfaces of Solid-Oxide-Fuel-Cell (SOFC) cathodes was examined.
Titulo: Surface modification of SOFC cathodes by Co, Ni, and Pd oxides

Sentencas: Monolayer amounts of Pd, Ni, and Co were deposited by atomic layer deposition (ALD) to cathodes prepared by impregnation of La0.8Sr0.2FeO3 (LSF), La0.8Sr0.2CoO3 (LSCo), and La0.6Sr0.4 Co0.2Fe0.8O3 (LSCF) into YSZ scaffolds.
Titulo: Surface modification of SOFC cathodes by Co, Ni, and Pd oxides

Sentencas: Incorporating the catalysts by ALD allowed modification of the surface composition without changing the cathode surface area or structure.
Titulo: Surface modification of SOFC cathodes by Co, Ni, and Pd oxides

Sentencas: X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy and High Sensitivity-Low Energy Ion Scattering were used to confirm ALD growth rates that were measured gravimetrically.
Titulo: Surface modification of SOFC cathodes by Co, Ni, and Pd oxides

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy indicated that the addition of Pd had a small negative effect on all of the cathodes.
Titulo: Surface modification of SOFC cathodes by Co, Ni, and Pd oxides

Sentencas: Ni and Co exhibited only a small effect on LSCo and LSCF cathodes but both decreased the cathode impedance for LSF.
Titulo: Surface modification of SOFC cathodes by Co, Ni, and Pd oxides

Sentencas: It is suggested that an essential feature in cathode promotion by Co and Ni is that these cations are incorporated into the perovskite surface and thereby increase the concentration of oxygen vacancies, while Pd only blocked adsorption sites.
Titulo: Surface modification of SOFC cathodes by Co, Ni, and Pd oxides
